title: Spinal Surgery Robot Simulator Operation and Design Training Program

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Medical Terminology and Understanding of Surgical Procedures, Experience with Digital Devices
context.additional_context: Education for systematically acquiring operational principles and simulation training systems of actual spinal surgery robotics.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the core components and operational procedures of a spinal surgery robot simulator.
Learners acquire practical skills to achieve over 90% accuracy in spinal fixation screw insertion in a simulation environment.
Through team-based scenario training, learners design and execute the entire process from preoperative planning to robotic system application.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
